results.title: [The Story of the Kelly gang] (AFC)
results.brief_description: Fragments of Australia’s first feature film which ran for over an hour. It was possibly the world’s first feature. Includes two sequences which might have been outtakes. One is a confrontation between Ned Kelly and a police constable, and the other a shootout between the gang and the police.

results.title: [The Stars who made the cinema]
results.brief_description: A series of vignettes from silent films with musical background made for the opening of the National Film Theatre, London, featuring the stars of many silent films in famous excerpts. Includes Rudolph Valentino with Vilma Banky in “The Black Eagle”, Conrad Veidt, Buster Keaton in “The General”, Charlie Chaplin in the “Pawnshop”, Lilian Gish in “Hearts of the World”, Mary Pickford, Harry Langdon and many others.

results.title: [The Role of parents in the school]
results.creator_credit: Gerry Bryant, Alexander Shaw and Crown Film Unit
results.brief_description: Details the importance parents can play in teaching children. Despite attempts to improve the British school system, children’s educational development is often retarded by parent apathy. This short dramatisation shows some examples of ways parents can interact meaningfully with their children and make them feel an important part of the family umit and society generally. Cast includes Maurice Denham, Jane Welsh, David Mercer, Marion Strauss.

results.title: [The Quiet one]
results.creator_credit: James Agee, Sidney Meyers and Janice Loeb
results.brief_description: An account of the rehabilitation at the Wilwyck School for Boys in the State of New York of an emotionally disturbed Negro boy who, abandoned by his parents, feels unwanted, misunderstood and inwardly tortured. Commentary and dialogue written by James Agee. Narrated by Gary Merrill.

results.title: [The Judy Garland collector's classic]
results.brief_description: Documentary using archival material, newsreels, motion picture excerpts, television appearances and private home movies on one of Hollywood’s legendary stars, singer/actor Judy Garland. Includes rare footage and a multi-star tribute at the premiere opening of “A Star is born”. This video also includes a collector’s bonus of the 1925 silent version of Wizard of Oz, directed by Larry Semon.

results.title: [The Incredible bread machine]
results.creator_credit: Theo Kamecke, John W. Doswell and World Research
results.brief_description: Based on a book of the same title by R. W. Grant, first published in 1966, and updated and extensively revised by Susan Love Brown and the student staff of Campus Studies Institute, World Research, under the supervision of Patty Newman in 1974. This docudrama film contains re-enactments based on true facts of various events that took place during the 1960’s and 1970’s relating to government department abuse of individual freedom and choice. For example, an Amish farmer who could not pay his taxes and subsequently lost his farm (which eventually turned into a parking lot), and a police agent drug bust on the wrong house (with no compensation to the couple who lived there). It focuses on government regulation and intervention, lobbyists and monopolies versus people’s freedom of choice and the right to food, shelter and equality.

results.title: [The Charm of Galloway]
